intro: Virotia neurophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaved virotia, is a small shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
